bug.author: 1wpro2
bug.summary: WebSocket is not working even though host and origin are same
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
WebSocket is not working even though host and origin are the same. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Deploy streamlit to any server (non-localhost) Put a proxy before streamlit Invoke the streamlit app from proxy server address, as such HOST and ORIGIN will be same when calling streamlit websocket
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Streamlit should work. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
WebSocket will not work, complaining about response code 403. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.50.2 Python version: 3.8 Using PipEnv OS version: Browser version: Chrome 79.0.3945.117

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/1wpro2>@1wpro2</denchmark-link> , is this fixed? If so, I will go ahead and close this bug.

Closing because fixed here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/965>#965</denchmark-link>
Please, reopen if you think it is not the case.

@1wpro2, is this fixed? If so, I will go ahead and close this bug.
Yes, thanks for closing it. üëç
